meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Security and Guarding Services Industry Authority, the issuing of permits to individuals doing security work, the licensing of security companies, and for connected matters.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Security and Guarding Services Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Commissioner (處長) means the Commissioner of Police or any police officer acting under and in accordance with an authorization conferred on him under section 27;

def.name: Company
def.leadIn: company (公司) means a body corporate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: incorporated under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: incorporated under a former Companies Ordinance as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: incorporated by any other Ordinance;

section.def: holder of a permit (持證人) means a person to whom a permit has been issued;
requisition notice (要求召開會議通知書) means a notice given under section 5A(2); (Added 25 of 2000 s. 2)

def.name: SecurityDevice
def.leadIn: security device (保安裝置) means a device designed or adapted to be installed in any premises or place, except on or in a vehicle, for the purpose of detecting or recording— (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the occurrence of any offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the presence of an intruder or of an object that persons are, for reasons of security, not permitted to bring onto the premises or place or any other premises or place;

def.name: SecurityWork
def.leadIn: security work (保安工作) means any of the following activities—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: guarding any property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: guarding any person or place for the purpose of preventing or detecting the occurrence of any offence; (Replaced 25 of 2000 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: installing, maintaining or repairing a security device;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: designing for any particular premises or place a system incorporating a security device.

subsection.content: Part II does not apply to any member of a class of persons specified in Schedule 1 when acting in his capacity as such member.
In relation to any person in respect of whom an exemption has been granted under section 8, this Ordinance applies subject to the terms of that exemption.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Security and Guarding Services Industry Authority

subsection.content: There shall be a “Security and Guarding Services Industry Authority”. (Amended E.R. 3 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Secretary for Security or his representative; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 5 other persons appointed by the Chief Executive. (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 3; 31 of 2025 s. 114)

subsection.content: The Authority shall appoint one of the members of the Authority (other than the Chairman of the Authority) as Vice-chairman.
The Secretary for Security shall appoint a Secretary to the Authority.

The Chairman of the Authority and other members of the Authority appointed under subsection (2)(c) may be remunerated and the amount (if any) of their remuneration shall be determined by the Chief Executive, but this subsection does not authorize the payment of remuneration to any person employed full time as a public officer. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 114)
Every appointment under subsection (2)(a) and (c) shall be notified in the Gazette.
The Authority shall meet at such times and at such places as the Chairman of the Authority shall direct.

If the Chairman of the Authority is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from making a direction under subsection (1), the Authority shall meet at such times and at such places as the Vice-chairman shall direct.
4 members of the Authority shall constitute a quorum at meetings of the Authority. (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 4)
The Chairman of the Authority or, if he is absent, the Vice-chairman shall preside at meetings of the Authority.

At meetings of the Authority all questions shall be decided by a majority of votes of the members of the Authority present and, where voting is equally divided, the Chairman of the Authority or, if he is absent, the Vice-chairman shall have a casting vote.
The Authority may regulate the procedure and conduct of its meetings.
Meetings of the Authority to hear any application under this Ordinance shall be open to the public except where the Authority is satisfied that this would not be in the public interest.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Transaction of business by the circulation of papers

subsection.content: The Authority may transact any of its business, other than business specified in subsection (4), by the circulation of papers; and, subject to subsections (2) and (3), a resolution in writing which is approved in writing by a majority of the members of the Authority shall be as valid and effectual as if it had been a resolution passed at a meeting of the Authority by the votes of the members so approving the resolution in writing.

Any member of the Authority may, by notice in writing to the Secretary within 7 days after the date on which the Secretary circulates the papers, require any business which is being transacted by circulation of papers to be transacted at a meeting of the Authority.

Where, in respect of any business being transacted by the circulation of papers, a notice is given to the Secretary under subsection (2), any resolution approved in writing under subsection (1) in respect of the business shall be void.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to the following business of the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for a variation of the conditions of a permit under section 16;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for a revocation or suspension of a permit under section 18;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application for a revocation of a licence under section 25;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an application for a licence, an application for renewal of a licence or an application for variation of the conditions of a licence except as provided in section 20 or that section as applied by section 23(4), or in section 24 or 24A (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: The functions of the Authority are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to consider and determine applications made to it under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), to specify, by notice in the Gazette—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the criteria that must be satisfied by a person before the Commissioner may issue a permit to him;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conditions subject to which a permit is to be issued;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the matters to which the Authority shall have regard when determining under section 21 an application for a licence under section 19; (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 6)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the criteria that must be satisfied before the Commissioner may, under section 8, grant a person an exemption from this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the matters to which the Authority shall have regard when determining whether the Authority should specify any, and if so what, period for the purpose of section 20(3)(a) or (6)(a) or 24A(4)(a); and (Added 25 of 2000 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to do such other things as it is required or authorized to do by this or any other Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: different criteria, conditions and matters in relation to different types of security work; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition that the holder of a permit shall do only a specified type of security work.

subsection.leadIn: A notice shall not be published in the Gazette under subsection (1)(b)(i) unless and until it has been—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: laid before; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approved by,

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that any notice under subsection (1)(b) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Powers of the Authority
section.leadIn: In order to consider and determine any application under this Ordinance, the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive and consider any material, whether by way of oral evidence, written statements, documents or otherwise, and whether or not it would be admissible in a court of law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing signed by the Chairman of the Authority or, if he is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from signing the notice, by the Vice-chairman, require the applicant or any other person having the right to appear at the hearing of the application—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to produce to it any document that is relevant to the application and is in his custody or under his control; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to appear before it and to give evidence relevant to the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: administer oaths and affirmations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require evidence to be given on oath or affirmation.

subsection.content: If the Commissioner is of the opinion that the criteria specified under section 6(1)(b)(iv) are satisfied in respect of any person, he may by notice in writing to that person grant him an exemption from all or any part of this Ordinance for a period not exceeding 14 days.
The Authority may by notice in writing to the person extend an exemption granted under subsection (1) for one further period not exceeding 30 days.

No personal liability shall be incurred by any person in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by him in good faith in relation to the performance or purported performance of any function under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting the generality of subsection (1), any party, witness, representative or other person appearing at or otherwise participating in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any meeting of the Authority under this Ordinance (including any meeting to hear an application under this Ordinance);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transaction of business of the Authority by circulation of papers under section 5A,

subsection.continued: shall have the same privileges and immunities as he would have if the meeting or transaction of business were civil proceedings conducted by the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Restrictions on doing security work
section.leadIn: No individual shall do, agree to do, or hold himself out as doing or as available to do, security work for another person unless he does so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under and in accordance with a permit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise than for reward.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Restrictions on supplying individuals to do security work

subsection.content: No person other than a company acting under and in accordance with a licence shall supply, agree to supply, or hold himself out as supplying any individual to do security work for another person for reward.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall supply an individual to do any type of security work for another person unless the individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the holder of a permit that is valid for that type of work; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is to do the security work otherwise than for reward.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Restrictions on obtaining benefit of security work

subsection.leadIn: No person shall authorize or require another person to do any type of security work for him unless the other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a holder of a permit that is valid for that type of work, a licensee, or an individual supplied by a licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is authorized or required to do the work otherwise than for reward.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to an occupier of domestic premises who authorizes or requires another person to do security work for him in relation only to those premises.

subsection.def: In this section, domestic premises (住所) means premises used or intended to be used solely or principally for residential purposes and constituting a separate household unit.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Obligations of employers in respect of security work

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), any person who employs an individual to do security work, whether for him or another person, for reward shall within 14 days after the commencement of the employment, give written notice to the Commissioner of the names of the employer and the employee and of the date on which the employment commenced.

Subject to subsection (3), any person who ceases to employ an individual to do security work for reward shall within 14 days after the termination of the employment give written notice to the Commissioner of the names of the employer and the former employee and of the date on which the employment ceased.

Subsection (1) does not apply to an occupier of domestic premises who employs, and subsection (2) does not apply to an occupier of domestic premises who ceases to employ, an individual to do security work for him in relation only to those premises.

subsection.def: In this section, domestic premises (住所) means premises used or intended to be used solely or principally for residential purposes and constituting a separate household unit.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Application for and issue of permit

subsection.content: An application for a permit shall be made to the Commissioner in such form and manner as the Authority may specify and shall be accompanied by a statement in writing containing such particulars in respect of the application as may be prescribed or as, in any particular case, the Commissioner may require.
A prescribed fee shall be paid by an applicant in respect of his application and, where appropriate, in respect of the issue of a permit to him.
A permit shall not be issued to a body of persons, whether corporate or unincorporate.

If the Commissioner has reason to believe that an applicant has at any time been convicted of an offence but the applicant denies this, the Commissioner may refuse to consider the application further unless the applicant submits to all such steps as are reasonably necessary for the taking and recording of such of the applicant’s fingerprints as the Commissioner may require; but if the Commissioner establishes from such fingerprints that the applicant has not been convicted of any offence, the Commissioner shall destroy or return to the applicant all photographs, copies and other records of those fingerprints.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (1), (2), (3) and (4), where the Commissioner is satisfied that an applicant is a fit and proper person to do a type of security work, the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall, if the applicant satisfies the criteria specified under section 6(1)(b)(i) in relation to security work of that type, issue a permit to the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, if the applicant does not satisfy those criteria, refer the application to the Authority and, if the Authority approves the application, the Commissioner shall issue a permit to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: A permit in respect of any type of security work shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be subject to the conditions specified under section 6(1)(b)(ii) in relation to security work of that type and such other conditions (if any) as the Commissioner may specify;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the prescribed form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the conditions, including any relevant conditions specified under section 6(1)(b)(ii), subject to which it is issued;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not be assignable or transmissible in any way (including on the death of the holder); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: be valid for 5 years, or such shorter period as the Commissioner may specify, beginning on the date on which it was issued.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (6)(a), the conditions of a permit that the Commissioner may specify include conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: limiting the type of security work for which the permit is valid;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: limiting the geographical area within which the holder of the permit may do security work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prohibiting the holder of the permit from wearing a uniform, or permitting him to wear a uniform of such type or pattern as the Commissioner may specify; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: requiring the holder of the permit to notify the Commissioner of any criminal proceedings instituted against the holder of the permit.

subsection.content: A holder of a permit that has not been revoked may apply to the Commissioner for the renewal of his permit.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the renewal of a permit shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made not earlier than 6 months before the permit is due to expire and not later than 3 months before the permit is due to expire;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made in such form and manner as the Authority may specify; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Section 14 applies to an application for the renewal of a permit as it applies to an application for a permit, and the Commissioner may when renewing a permit impose on the holder of the permit any condition in addition to or instead of any condition (other than a condition specified under section 6(1)(b)(ii)) previously imposed on him.

Any permit in respect of which an application for renewal is made under this section and which would (apart from this subsection) expire before the determination of the application shall, unless the application is withdrawn, or the permit is revoked or suspended under section 17 or 18, continue in force until the determination of the application.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: A prescribed fee is payable by the holder of a permit in respect of the renewal of the permit. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 8)
A renewal of a permit under this section shall be deemed to be granted on the day following the day on which the permit would have expired if no application for renewal had been made.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Application for variation of conditions of permit

subsection.content: In respect of any permit, the Commissioner or the holder of the permit may apply to the Authority for a variation of the conditions of the permit, including conditions specified under section 6(1)(b)(ii).

subsection.leadIn: Where an application is made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary shall, within 7 days of the date of that application, fix a date for the hearing of the application and shall give at least 14 days’ notice of that date to the Commissioner and the holder of the permit; and (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 9)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority or any member of the Authority authorized by the Authority to do so may by notice in writing to the Commissioner and to the holder of the permit vary the conditions of the permit until such time as the application is determined.

subsection.content: The holder of the permit and the Commissioner may appear and be heard and be legally represented at the hearing of an application under this section.
On an application under this section the Authority may, if it thinks fit, vary the conditions of the permit.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Revocation of permit
section.content: Where any holder of a permit is convicted of any offence specified in column 2 of Schedule 2 and the penalty imposed on him for that offence is the penalty specified in relation to that offence in column 3 of that Schedule, the Commissioner shall, by notice in writing to the holder of the permit, revoke the permit.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Application for revocation or suspension of permit

subsection.content: Where, in the opinion of the Commissioner, a holder of a permit is no longer a fit and proper person to hold the permit or where the holder of the permit has been in breach of any condition of the permit, the Commissioner may apply to the Authority for a revocation or suspension of the permit.

subsection.leadIn: Where an application is made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary shall, within 7 days of the date of that application, fix a date for the hearing of the application and shall give at least 14 days’ notice of that date to the Commissioner and the holder of the permit; and that notice shall call on the holder of the permit to show cause as to why an order for the revocation or suspension of his permit ought not to be made; (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 10)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner may by notice in writing to the holder of the permit suspend the permit or vary the conditions of the permit for a period before the determination of the application and not exceeding 21 days; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the Commissioner does so, the Authority may by notice in writing to the holder suspend the permit or vary the conditions of the permit for such further period before that determination as it thinks appropriate.

subsection.content: The holder of the permit and the Commissioner may appear and be heard and be legally represented at the hearing of an application under this section.

On an application under this section, the Authority may, if satisfied that the holder of the permit is no longer a fit and proper person to hold the permit or has been in breach of any condition of the permit, revoke the permit or suspend the permit for such period as it considers appropriate.

Except for the purposes of section 15, the holder of a permit that has been suspended under this section shall be treated, in respect of the period of suspension, as if the permit had not been issued.

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Replacement of permit
section.content: The Commissioner may, if satisfied that any permit has been lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, issue a replacement of the permit to its holder on payment of the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: An application for a licence may be made only by a company.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a licence shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made to the Authority in such form and manner as the Authority may specify; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a statement in writing containing such particulars in respect of the application as may be prescribed or as, in any particular case, the Authority may require; and

subsection.content: Where an application is made for a licence, the applicant shall at the same time send a copy of the application to the Commissioner, and the Commissioner may cause an investigation to be carried out in respect of the application for the purpose of determining whether, in the opinion of the Commissioner, there are grounds for objecting to the application.

For the purpose of carrying out an investigation under this section, the Commissioner may in writing require the applicant to produce for inspection such books, records or documents or to furnish such information relating to the application or any business carried on or intended to be carried on by it as the Commissioner may specify.

subsection.leadIn: In respect of an application for a licence, no step shall be taken by the Authority before—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date immediately following the end of a period of 60 days, or of such longer period as the Authority may specify in the particular case under subsection (7), after the day on which the application was made; or (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 13)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the Commissioner notifies the Authority that any investigation carried out under this section in respect of the application has been completed,

subsection.continued: whichever is the earlier (in this section referred to as the material date). (Amended E.R. 3 of 2022)

subsection.content: Where the Commissioner intends to object to an application for a licence, he shall, within a period of 7 days beginning on the material date, serve notice on the Authority of his intention to object and of the grounds of such objection, and he shall send a copy to the applicant. (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 13)

Where the Commissioner has served a notice of his intention to object to the application under subsection (4), the Secretary shall, within 7 days after the service of the notice, fix a date for the hearing of the application. (Replaced 25 of 2000 s. 13)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has, before the expiry of the period specified in subsection (4), notified the Authority in writing that he does not intend to object to the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has, on the expiry of the period specified in subsection (4), neither served a notice of his intention to object to the application under that subsection nor given the notification under paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: the Secretary shall, in order that the application may be determined by the Authority by circulation of papers in accordance with section 5A, circulate papers relevant to the application to members of the Authority. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 13)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.leadIn: Upon circulation of papers under subsection (5A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a requisition notice is given, the Secretary shall forthwith fix a date for the hearing of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no requisition notice is given and the Authority resolves to grant the application in accordance with section 5A within 28 days after the material date, the resolution shall be as valid and effectual as if it were a determination made by the Authority after a hearing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if no requisition notice is given but no resolution under paragraph (b) has been approved, the Secretary shall forthwith fix a date for the hearing of the application. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 13)

subsection.name: 5C
subsection.content: The Secretary shall give at least 14 days’ notice of the date fixed under subsection (5) or (5B) to the Commissioner and the applicant. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: An applicant for a licence may, before the application is determined, amend the application by informing the Authority in writing of the amendment and at the same time sending a copy of the amendment to the Commissioner; but where such an amendment is made, the material date in relation to that application shall, for the purposes of subsections (3), (4) and (5B), be— (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date immediately following the end of a period of 60 days, or of such longer period as the Authority may specify in the particular case under subsection (7), after the day on which the Authority was so informed; or (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 13)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date after the Authority was so informed on which the Commissioner notifies the Authority that any investigation carried out under this section in respect of that application has been completed,

subsection.leadIn: Before the 60 days’ period under subsection (3)(a) or (6)(a) expires or (where a longer period has been specified under this subsection) before the longer period expires, the Commissioner or the applicant may request the Authority to make a specification for the purposes of subsection (3)(a) or (6)(a). The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the request, specify a period if the Authority considers it appropriate to do so;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: exercise the power under paragraph (a) at most twice in respect of a particular application and may—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the first time, specify a period not longer than 90 days;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the second time, specify a period not longer than 120 days,

paragraph.continued: beginning on the day after the application was made or the Authority was informed of the amendment (as the case may be),

subsection.continued: and where a period is so specified the Secretary shall give notice in writing of the specification to the applicant and the Commissioner. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 13)

subsection.content: The Authority shall, in considering an application for a licence, have regard to any evidence adduced by or on behalf of the applicant and any evidence adduced by or on behalf of the Commissioner. (Replaced 25 of 2000 s. 14)
Subject to subsection (3), the Authority may issue a licence to an applicant and may impose such conditions as the Authority may specify.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall not issue a licence to an applicant unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to supply individuals to do security work of the type proposed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who is a controller of the applicant is a fit and proper person to be a controller of a company that supplies individuals to do security work of the type proposed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the security equipment and methods used or proposed to be used by the applicant are adequate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant’s proposed method of supervising the individuals it supplies to do security work is suitable.

subsection.content: In deciding whether or not to issue a licence authorizing an applicant to supply individuals to do a type of security work, the Authority shall have regard to the matters specified by it under section 6(1)(b)(iii) in relation to that type of security work.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2), the conditions that the Authority may impose include conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specifying the persons who shall or shall not be officers concerned in the management of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: relating to the business premises and facilities of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: limiting the type of security work in respect of which the licensee may supply individuals;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: limiting the geographical area within which security work may be done by individuals supplied by the licensee; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prohibiting the licensee from supplying individuals to do security work wearing uniforms, or permitting the licensee to supply individuals to do security work wearing uniforms of such type or pattern as the Commissioner may specify.

subsection.def: In this section, controller (控制人), in relation to an applicant, means a majority shareholder controller, minority shareholder controller or indirect controller, within the meaning of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), of the applicant.

section.name: s21A
section.heading: Licence fee
section.leadIn: A fee is payable by the applicant in respect of a licence issued under this Part as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the issue of the licence, the prescribed annual fee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or before each successive anniversary of the date of issue of the licence during the term of the licence as issued, a fee equal to the fee that was payable on the issue of the licence under paragraph (a).

section.name: s22
section.heading: Form, validity and conditions of licence

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the prescribed form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the conditions subject to which it is issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not be assignable or transmissible in any way; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be valid for 5 years, or such shorter period as the Authority may specify, beginning on the date on which it was issued, provided that during those years all prescribed fees are paid as prescribed.

subsection.content: A licensee may apply to the Authority for the renewal of his licence.
This section does not apply to a licensee whose licence is revoked.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the renewal of a licence shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made not earlier than 6 months before the licence is due to expire and not later than 3 months before the licence is due to expire;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made in such form and manner as the Authority may specify; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Sections 19, 20 and 21 apply to an application for renewal made under this section as they apply to an application for a licence, and the Authority may when renewing a licence impose on the licensee any condition in addition to or instead of any condition previously imposed on him.

Any licence in respect of which an application for renewal is made under this section and which would (apart from this subsection) expire before the determination of the application shall, unless the application is withdrawn, or the licence is revoked under section 25, continue in force until the determination of the application.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: A fee is payable by the licensee in respect of the renewal of its licence as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the renewal of the licence, the prescribed annual fee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or before each successive anniversary of the date of renewal of the licence during the term of the licence as renewed, a fee equal to the fee that was payable on the renewal of the licence under paragraph (a). (Added 25 of 2000 s. 16)

subsection.content: A renewal of a licence under this section shall be deemed to be granted on the day following the day on which the licence would have expired if no application for renewal had been made.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Application by the Commissioner for variation of conditions of licence

subsection.content: The Commissioner may apply to the Authority for a variation of the conditions of a licence and shall at the same time send a copy of the application to the licensee. (Replaced 25 of 2000 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Where the licensee intends to object to an application under subsection (1), the licensee shall, within 30 days after the day on which the application was made, serve notice on the Authority of his intention to object and of the grounds of such objection, and he shall send a copy to the Commissioner. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Where the licensee has served a notice of its intention to object to the application under subsection (1A), the Secretary shall, within 7 days after the service of the notice, fix a date for the hearing of the application. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Where the licensee has, before the expiry of the period specified in subsection (1A), notified the Authority in writing that it does not intend to object to the application (no-objection notification), the Secretary shall, in order that the application may be determined by the Authority by circulation of papers in accordance with section 5A, circulate papers relevant to the application to members of the Authority; and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a requisition notice is given, the Secretary shall forthwith fix a date for the hearing of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no requisition notice is given and the Authority resolves to grant the application in accordance with section 5A within 28 days after the day on which the Authority receives the no-objection notification, the resolution shall be as valid and effectual as if it were a determination made by the Authority after a hearing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if no requisition notice is given but no resolution under paragraph (b) has been approved, the Secretary shall forthwith fix a date for the hearing of the application. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: If at the expiry of the period specified in subsection (1A) the licensee has neither served a notice of his intention to object to the application under that subsection nor given the no-objection notification, the Secretary shall, within 7 days after that expiry, fix a date for the hearing of the application. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.content: The Secretary shall give at least 14 days’ notice of the date fixed under subsection (1B), (1C) or (1D) to the Commissioner and the licensee. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 17)

After an application has been made under subsection (1), the Authority or any member of the Authority authorized by the Authority to do so may, by notice in writing to the Commissioner and to the licensee, vary the conditions of the licence pending determination of the application. (Replaced 25 of 2000 s. 17)
The licensee and the Commissioner may appear and be heard and be legally represented at the hearing of an application under this section.
On an application under this section the Authority may, if it thinks fit, vary the conditions of the licence.

section.name: s24A
section.heading: Application by the licensee for variation of conditions of licence

subsection.content: A licensee may apply to the Authority for a variation of the conditions of its licence and shall at the same time send a copy of the application to the Commissioner.

Where an application is made under subsection (1), the Commissioner may cause an investigation to be carried out in respect of the application for the purpose of determining whether, in the opinion of the Commissioner, there are grounds for objecting to the application.

For the purpose of carrying out an investigation under this section, the Commissioner may in writing require the licensee making an application under subsection (1) to produce for inspection such books, records or documents or to furnish such information relating to the application or any business carried on or intended to be carried on by it as the Commissioner may specify.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (11), no step shall be taken by the Authority in respect of an application made under subsection (1) before—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date immediately following the end of a period of 60 days, or of such longer period as the Authority may specify in the particular case under subsection (5), after the day on which the application was made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the Commissioner notifies the Authority that any investigation carried out under this section in respect of the application has been completed,

subsection.continued: whichever is the earlier (in this section referred to as the material date).

subsection.leadIn: Before the 60 days’ period under subsection (4)(a) expires or (where a longer period has been specified under this subsection) before the longer period expires, the Commissioner or the licensee may request the Authority to make a specification for the purposes of subsection (4)(a). The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the request, specify a period if the Authority considers it appropriate to do so;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: exercise the power under paragraph (a) at most twice in respect of a particular application and may—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the first time, specify a period not longer than 90 days;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the second time, specify a period not longer than 120 days,

paragraph.continued: beginning on the day after the application was made,

subsection.continued: and where a period is so specified the Secretary shall give notice in writing of the specification to the licensee and the Commissioner.

subsection.content: Where the Commissioner intends to object to an application under subsection (1), he shall, within a period of 7 days beginning on the material date, serve notice on the Authority of his intention to object and of the grounds of such objection, and he shall send a copy to the licensee.

Where the Commissioner has served a notice of his intention to object to the application under subsection (6), the Secretary shall, within 7 days after the service of the notice, fix a date for the hearing of the application.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has, before the expiry of the period specified in subsection (6), notified the Authority in writing that he does not intend to object to the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has, on the expiry of the period specified in subsection (6), neither served a notice of his intention to object to the application under that subsection nor given the notification under paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: the Secretary shall, in order that the application may be determined by the Authority by circulation of papers in accordance with section 5A, circulate papers relevant to the application to members of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Upon circulation of papers under subsection (8)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a requisition notice is given, the Secretary shall forthwith fix a date for the hearing of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no requisition notice is given and the Authority resolves to grant the application in accordance with section 5A within 28 days after the material date, the resolution shall be as valid and effectual as if it were a determination made by the Authority after a hearing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if no requisition notice is given but no resolution under paragraph (b) has been approved, the Secretary shall forthwith fix a date for the hearing of the application.

subsection.content: The Secretary shall give at least 14 days’ notice of the date fixed under subsection (7) or (9) to the Commissioner and the licensee.

After an application has been made under subsection (1) (including the period before the material date), the Authority or any member of the Authority authorized by the Authority to do so may, by notice in writing to the Commissioner and to the licensee, vary the conditions of the licence pending determination of the application.
The licensee and the Commissioner may appear and be heard and be legally represented at the hearing of an application under this section.
On an application under subsection (1) the Authority may, if it thinks fit, vary the conditions of the licence.

Where, in the opinion of the Commissioner, a licensee is no longer a fit and proper person to hold the licence or where the licensee has been in breach of any condition of the licence, the Commissioner may apply to the Authority for a revocation of the licence.

Where an application is made under subsection (1) the Secretary shall, within 14 days of the date of that application, fix a date for the hearing of the application and shall give at least 14 days’ notice of that date to the Commissioner and the licensee; and that notice shall call on the licensee to show cause as to why an order for the revocation of his licence ought not to be made. (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 19)
The licensee and the Commissioner may appear and be heard and be legally represented at the hearing of an application under this section.

On an application under this section, the Authority may, if satisfied that the licensee is no longer a fit and proper person to hold the licence or has been in breach of any condition of the licence, revoke the licence.

section.name: s25A
section.heading: Replacement of licence
section.content: The Authority may, if satisfied that any licence has been lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, issue a replacement of the licence to the licensee on payment of the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Any person aggrieved by a decision under section 14(5), 15(3), 16(4), 18(4), 21(2), 23(4), 24(4), 24A(13) or 25(4) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board within 10 days after receiving notice of the decision. (Amended 25 of 2000 s. 21)

A decision to which this subsection applies by virtue of subsection (3) that is appealed against under subsection (1) shall be suspended in its operation as from the day on which the appeal is made until such appeal is disposed of, withdrawn or abandoned unless such suspension would, in the opinion of the Authority, be contrary to the public interest and the notice of the decision contains a statement to that effect.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies to a decision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 18(4) to revoke or suspend a permit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under section 21(2) to issue a licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: under section 25(4) to revoke a licence.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Delegation of powers and duties
section.content: The Commissioner of Police may authorize in writing any public officer to exercise any power vested in him or to perform any duty imposed on him by virtue of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of ascertaining whether the provisions of this Ordinance are being complied with, a police officer of or above the rank of inspector, or any other police officer authorized in writing for the purposes of this section by a police officer of or above the rank of superintendent, may enter any premises of a licensee and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect any books, accounts or documents relating to the licensee’s business and take notes, copies or extracts of or from them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inspect the facilities enjoyed by the licensee in relation to his business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: obtain information about the training procedures adopted by the licensee in relation to his business.

subsection.content: If it is made to appear to a magistrate by information upon oath that there is reason to believe that an offence against section 10, 11, 12 or 13 is being committed in any place, the magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing any police officer to enter and search that place. (Amended 47 of 1997 s. 10)

section.name: s28A
section.heading: Fees received to form part of the general revenue

subsection.content: All fees received under this Ordinance form part of the general revenue.

For the avoidance of doubt, all fees received before the commencement date* for section 22 of the Security and Guarding Services (Amendment) Ordinance 2000 (25 of 2000) are declared to form and to have always formed part of the general revenue.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Power to amend Schedules 1 and 2
section.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1 or 2.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation prescribe the fees to be paid under sections 14(2), 15(2)(c) and (4A), 18A, 19(2)(b)(ii), 21A, 23(3)(c) and (5A) and 25A. (Replaced 25 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Any fees prescribed in regulations made under subsection (1) may be fixed by reference to the nature of business of the licensee. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Any fees prescribed in regulations made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be fixed at levels sufficient to effect the recovery of expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred by the Government or the Authority in performing any or all functions under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be limited by reason only of the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred by the Government or the Authority in performing any function under this Ordinance as regards any particular person or class of persons. (Added 25 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Security may by regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe anything required or permitted to be prescribed under this Ordinance except fees;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for the revocation of a licence for failure to pay any fee, or part thereof, required to be paid in respect of that licence; and (Replaced 25 of 2000 s. 23)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the better carrying into effect of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes section 11(1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.
Any person who contravenes section 10, 11(2), 12 or 13 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuses or fails to comply with any lawful order, requirement or direction of the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disturbs or otherwise interferes with the proceedings of the Authority,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Transitional provision relating to watchman’s permit

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a holder of a watchman’s permit, within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Ordinance repealed under section 32, shall be deemed for the purposes of this Ordinance to be a holder of a permit that is valid for an unlimited period of time.
The Authority may by notice given to the holder of a watchman’s permit cancel that permit at the end of a period of 3 months after the date of that notice.
For the purpose of subsection (2), a notice shall be deemed to be given to a person if it is sent by prepaid post to his last known postal address.

subsection.leadIn: Where a licence issued before the commencement* of section 2(b) of the Security and Guarding Services (Amendment) Ordinance 2000 (25 of 2000) (in this section referred to as the 2000 Amending Ordinance) makes reference to any activity which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is security work for the purposes of this Ordinance immediately before that commencement; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not security work for the purposes of this Ordinance as amended by that section,

subsection.continued: the licence shall, in respect of the remainder of its term after that commencement, be treated as a licence that does not contain that reference.

subsection.leadIn: Where, immediately before the commencement* of sections 12 and 15 of the 2000 Amending Ordinance, a licence fee is payable in respect of any licence under this Ordinance as it then applied (whether or not allowed to be paid by instalments under section 4 of the Security and Guarding Services (Fees) Regulation (Cap. 460 sub. leg. A)), then— (Amended E.R. 3 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: during the remainder of the term for which the licence was issued, section 21A of this Ordinance does not apply in relation to the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Where immediately before the commencement* of section 13(d) and (e) of the 2000 Amending Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made under section 19 or 23 of this Ordinance is pending; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Secretary has given notice of the date fixed for the hearing of the application (whether or not the hearing has commenced),

subsection.continued: the application shall be determined in accordance with this Ordinance as if section 13(d) and (e) of the 2000 Amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.content: Where, immediately before the commencement* date for sections 17 and 18 of the 2000 Amending Ordinance, an application made under section 24 of this Ordinance is pending, the application shall be determined in accordance with this Ordinance as if sections 17 and 18 of the 2000 Amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

Except as provided in this section, any amendment made by a provision of the 2000 Amending Ordinance applies to and in relation to an application made or a licence issued under this Ordinance before the commencement of that provision as it applies to and in relation to an application made or a licence issued on or after that commencement.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Persons to whom Part II does not Apply

td.p: Members of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)
Officials, or employees, of the Central People’s Government or of other competent authorities of the People’s Republic of China (Replaced 31 of 2025 s. 117)

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Offences for which Permit to be Revoked

td.p: Any offence against the Societies Ordinance (Cap. 151) or the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance (Cap. 134)
Any offence involving fraud or dishonesty
Any offence against Part XII of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200) (Amended L.N. 48 of 2003)
